verses.text: Yo, these are Solomon’s proverbs — straight facts from Israel’s king, son of David.
They drop wisdom and understanding, so you can know life and make smart moves.
They teach right living, fairness, and keeping it real in the world.
They give sense to beginners and knowledge to young peeps.
Even the wise can hear more and level up.
They help understand puzzles, clever sayings, and hidden truths.
Respecting God is the start of real wisdom. Ignore Him? You’re just foolish.
Listen up, my kid — don’t ghost your father’s advice or skip your mother’s teaching.
Their words are like chains of honor — they protect and bless you.
If the wrong crowd tries to pull you into shady moves, don’t roll with them.
They might say, “Come, let’s lie in wait for someone to steal from them.” Don’t go there.
They lie in wait for evil, planning harm.
They think, “We’ll get rich by doing wrong.” Don’t follow that path.
Stay away — their way ends in disaster.
My child, keep your feet clean; don’t step into their mess.
Their path is risky, their ways collapse on themselves.
Stolen gain is useless — the trap is set in vain.
The violent/wicked lie in wait for their own lives — self-destruction comes for them.
Greed never wins; it always backfires.
Wisdom shouts in the streets, calling out in public squares.
She speaks at city gates, calling out to those who lack sense.
But fools ignore her, scrolling past, thinking she’s irrelevant.
“Turn to me and live,” she says. “Pay attention — blessings follow.”
But they refuse and reject her advice.
When trouble comes, they’re shocked: “Where was the warning?”
I called, but they ignored me; their choices trap them.
Trouble comes like a storm, and fear won’t save them.
They cry for help, but it’s too late — trapped by their own decisions.
They hated knowledge and rejected wisdom.
So they pay for ignoring her words.
Foolishness traps them; consequences are real.
Their choices roast them; consequences hit hard.
But anyone who listens to Wisdom will live safe, chill, and blessed — no stress, no fear.
Yo, my kid, if you vibe with my words and keep my commands close,
Tune in, pay attention to wisdom, and chase understanding.
Call for it like it’s the hottest drop — search for it like you’re hunting treasure.
Seek it like rare loot, grinding hard like it’s your main quest.
If you do, you’ll finally get the fear of the Lord and find knowledge of God.
‘Cause God’s the plug — He drops wisdom, understanding, and insight straight.
He keeps the righteous safe, guarding those who walk in integrity.
He shields the true-hearted, protecting them from wrong moves.
Then you’ll understand righteousness, justice, and fairness — all the real moves.
Wisdom slides in, and knowledge vibes with your soul.
Discretion guards you, and understanding watches your back.
They’ll save you from shady paths, from people walking twisted ways.
From those who leave the straight track and wander into darkness.
From people acting shady, scheming evil, and rolling in sin.
Their path is crooked; their steps collapse on themselves.
Wisdom saves you from the smooth talkers who seduce with lies.
From those who abandon loyalty and leave their true paths.
Their house leads to death; their paths are fatal.
Anyone stuck in that chaos won’t return — destruction is waiting.
Walk in the way of good people, stick to the path of the righteous.
Then you’ll inhabit the land securely; the upright remain planted there.
But the wicked? They’re removed from life — their fate ends in ruin.
My kid, don’t forget my words; keep my commands close to your heart.
They’ll add length to your life and bring peace every day.
Don’t lose loyalty and love — keep them tight around your neck; they’ll flex honor and respect.
Then you’ll gain favor and a solid reputation with God and people.
Trust the Lord fully; don’t lean only on your own brain.
In everything you do, acknowledge Him, and He’ll make your path straight.
Don’t act all wise in your own eyes — fear God, and steer clear of evil.
That’ll bring health to your body and strength to your bones.
Honor God with your wealth; give your firstfruits of all your crops.
Then your barns will overflow, and your vats will run over with juice.
My kid, don’t ghost the Lord’s discipline; don’t get mad when He corrects you.
God trains the ones He loves, like a coach pushing their star player.
Blessed is the one who grabs wisdom — they’re living the dream.
She’s more valuable than silver; her reward beats gold.
She’s worth more than jewels; nothing you want compares.
Long life is in her right hand; wealth and honor in her left.
Her ways are pleasant, and all her paths are chill.
She’s a tree of life for those who hold her tight; whoever grabs her is blessed.
By wisdom, the Lord laid the earth’s foundations and set the skies in place.
By His knowledge, the depths split, and clouds drip dew.
My kid, keep wisdom and discretion tight; don’t lose them.
They’ll be life for your soul and flex for your neck.
Then you’ll walk without stress and sleep safe, no nightmares.
When you lie down, you won’t fear; you’ll snooze, peaceful.
Don’t stress over sudden drama or the chaos of the wicked.
God will keep you safe; He’ll guard your life.
Don’t hold back good from people who deserve it when you can act.
Don’t say, “Go come back tomorrow,” when you can help today.
Don’t plot harm against your neighbor — they’re counting on you.
Don’t fight over nothing; stay chill with people.
Don’t envy violent people; don’t copy their ways.
The Lord hates wickedness but loves those who walk right.
The Lord blesses the home of the righteous, but the house of the wicked is doomed.
He mocks the mockers but gives grace to the humble.
The wise inherit glory, but fools get nothing but shame.
My kids, listen up — tune in to your parents’ teaching; pay attention to get wisdom.
These words are life; don’t ghost them.
I was a kid too; my father taught me, my mom showed me the ropes.
They said, “Hold onto this knowledge — it’s your shield.”
Grab wisdom, level up, don’t let go; get insight and keep it close.
Flex it like a chain around your neck; it’ll keep you safe.
Wisdom is top-tier — get it, and life is unlocked. Understanding comes with the grind.
Keep it high, and it’ll lift you; embrace it, and it’ll protect you.
Its glow is like a crown; its shine is like a chain of honor.
Listen, my kid, and your life will be lit; years will be added to your grind.
I’ll teach you the right path; I’ll guide you on the straight track.
Walk it and you won’t trip; step by step, you’ll be safe.
Grab wisdom tight; don’t let it go — it’s your life’s main flex.
Don’t roll with the wicked; don’t vibe with the shady crowd.
Avoid their path; don’t walk where they wander.
The wicked can’t chill — they stay up scheming evil, robbed of sleep until someone falls.
They live off wickedness and violence; that’s their daily bread and wine.
The path of the righteous? Shines brighter and brighter; their grind gets clearer every day.
But the wicked? They live in darkness; their path is sketchy and doomed.
My kid, pay attention to my words; listen closely to what I say.
Don’t let them drift off; keep them in your heart, guard them tight.
They’re life for your soul; health for your whole vibe.
Above all, guard your heart — it’s the main source of life.
Don’t let your mouth slip evil; keep your lips from lying.
Eyes forward, straight ahead; watch your path, no side glances.
Make level paths for your feet; don’t wobble.
Don’t veer left or right; keep moving on the straight track.
My kid, pay attention to my wisdom; lean in to get insight.
Guard discretion; keep your lips from shady moves.
The lips of the adulterous are honey-sweet, smooth talk.
But in the end, they’re bitter as wormwood, sharp like a double-edged sword.
Their feet go down to death; their steps run straight to the shades.
They don’t even pause to look at the path of life.
My kid, listen to me; don’t stray from my words of guidance.
Stay clear, don’t wander toward their house.
Don’t give your honor to strangers; don’t let your years go to cruel people.
Don’t let your cash and grind go to strangers; don’t let your hard work end up in outsiders’ hands.
Then you’ll groan when your body and life are wasted,
And you say, “How did I hate instruction? How did I despise correction?”
I didn’t listen to advice; I ignored all warnings.
I ended up in the crowd of the foolish, lost in the gang of the wicked.
Drink water from your own cistern, fresh water from your own well.
Should your fountains be scattered in the streets, streams of your blessing out where they don’t belong?
Let it be only for you; don’t share it with outsiders.
Be blessed with the wife of your youth; enjoy her love every day.
She’s your charm, your love — never lose sight of her grace.
Why be consumed with strangers, the smooth talk of others?
The Lord sees all your ways; He watches every step you take.
The wicked are caught by their own sin; they are trapped by the ways of their actions.
The consequences of sin? Death, no excuses — the righteous live safe through the fear of God.
My kid, if you co-sign for a friend, you’re basically risking your bag.
You’ve trapped yourself; now you’re on the hook.
Break free fast — tell them, “Yo, I’m out,” before your wallet gets wrecked.
Don’t let them drag you down; save yourself before you fall.
Don’t slack, free yourself like a gazelle escaping a trap.
Check out the ant, lazybones — no boss, no schedule, still stacking food all summer.
They grind hard, no excuses; they prep for tomorrow while you sleep.
You should be wise too; stash your moves and prep like the ant.
How long will you crash in bed, lazy? When will you actually rise and grind?
A little nap, a little sleep, a little folding of hands to chill —
And boom! Poverty hits you like a hitmarker; want bites, end up broke.
A wicked dude? Smooth talker, plotting evil — his words slice deep.
He winks, nods, shakes hands, all fake — scheming in silence.
He plants trouble everywhere, ready to spark chaos at every turn.
Disaster’s coming for him; sudden ruin, no saving.
There are six things the Lord hates, seven that He can’t vibe with:
Proud eyes, lying tongue, hands that spill innocent blood,
Heart that plots evil, feet that rush to do wrong,
False witness dropping lies, one who sparks drama between siblings.
My kid, keep your father’s command; don’t ghost your mother’s rules.
Bind them tight around your neck; carry them wherever you roll.
They’ll guide you — wisdom, insight — when the grind gets rough.
The command is a lamp; instruction is light; correction is the path to life.
They’ll keep you safe from evil moves, protecting your vibe.
Don’t cheat on your love, don’t lust after a stranger.
For the adultery-seeker? Even the hardest man gets played; they get trapped.
Can a fire burn in your lap without roasting your thighs?
Can a wanderer walk on coals and not scorch their feet?
So whoever messes around with another’s spouse ends up burned by their own sin.
Thieves? They hate being caught.
But if caught, they pay back sevenfold, double the damage.
Sleeping with someone else’s spouse? No chill — destroys life, nothing but regret.
Wounds and shame hit hard; your reputation gone.
Fumes of rage from the betrayed partner, no mercy, no compromise.
The one who cheats? They’ll never escape; they’re trapped in their own foolishness.
Yo, guard my words like your ultimate flex; keep my commands locked in your chest.
Wear them like a chain around your neck, let them guide every step.
They’ll save you from the traps fools lay out for themselves.
Tell Wisdom, “You’re my real one; Insight, you’re my squad” — keep her close.
They’ll watch over your path, keep you from the schemes of evil.
I peeped out my window, late night — streets quiet, but alert.
A young man, clueless, heading the wrong way, naive in the game.
At the corner, there she was — the woman who’s trouble.
He didn’t know; desire blinded him fully.
She’s bold, reckless, fully plotting.
Up late, looking for someone to snare.
Bed ready, fine linens, perfume set — everything prepared.
She meets him, moves smooth, eyes on the prize.
Words slick, pulling him closer, no hesitation.
“I came out to meet you, been seeking your face, and here you are.”
“My bed is ready, linens fresh, perfume on point.”
“Come, let’s enjoy ourselves till morning, let’s go all in.”
“Hubby’s away, long trip, won’t be back soon.”
“No one’s watching; no one will catch us.”
He follows blindly, desire taking the wheel, ignoring danger.
Kid, keep your eyes sharp; don’t walk her path.
Her house leads down to Sheol, straight to the chambers of death.
None who enter her return; her paths destroy.
Don’t chase fleeting thrills; avoid her trap.
Guard your heart; keep your focus.
Don’t get snared by her looks; don’t follow her steps.
Her house? The way to Sheol, down to the chambers of death — all who enter it are caught.
